column1: It has been such an honor serving the people of Colorado in the Senate for the past 6 years.  Tune in to my speech now at https://t.co/iZRRyor3HL. https://t.co/volKzMT8ya
Castle Rock was my next stop along the Front Range! If you haven’t done so already make sure that you go and vote! https://t.co/HKtHuCJNgv
Jaime and I are in Brighton reminding you to get out and vote! Get to a polling place or drop off your ballot today! https://t.co/kXCTjbPRT1
Election Day with @BuckForColorado! Make your voice heard and vote today! https://t.co/OOBjo9mVis
Out in Windsor this morning with @BuckForColorado thanking Coloradans for getting out and voting. https://t.co/PXCBJkArE2

For the past six years I’ve had the great privilege of serving the people of Colorado.   I need your vote to help me continue this fight and accomplish so much more for our state. https://t.co/Wmtlf0R3gp
My next stop on the Western Slope was in Mesa County. Be sure to turn in your ballot so that your vote counts! https://t.co/eWHY9zXZT9
It was a pleasure spending time in Delta this morning. Don’t forget to vote! #TeamGardner https://t.co/wiH1yvqAt2
I enjoyed speaking to voters in Montrose today! Thank you for all of your support. #TeamGardner https://t.co/bkdbZIuX3u
Happy Halloween from Yuma! https://t.co/xbHv9E9x9W

Hickenlooper failed to prepare Colorado for a pandemic when he was Governor. He didn’t do the job here and he certainly won’t do the job in Washington. https://t.co/f5NbrzGFcZ
“It’s a hypothetical.” -John Hickenlooper on court packing.   Folks there is simply too much at stake to take a 150 year Supreme Court precedent as a “hypothetical”. https://t.co/jx5HF1E5o5
Generations of hopeful and hardworking citizens have called Colorado home. I’ll continue to fight for them and be a fierce advocate in the Senate. #cosen #copolitics
I work for the people of Colorado.
We don’t need to guess if Hickenlooper would be a good Senator: He’s told us he wouldn’t and that he’d hate it. #cosen #copolitics
I will not destroy the economy in pursuit of a radical Green New Deal. #cosen #copolitics
I passed the Great American Outdoors Act - the biggest piece of conservation legislation to come out of Congress in over 50 years. #cosen #copolitics
Let’s be clear: Court packing consists of adding judges to our Supreme Court. #cosen #copolitics
We don’t need Hickenlooper’s dirty laundry in the Senate. #cosen #copolitics https://t.co/tntcw0BcNE
I wrote a bill that protects people with pre-existing conditions no matter what happens to Obamacare. #cosen #copolitics
We need to make sure that all Coloradans have access to healthcare. #cosen #copolitics
Watch my fourth debate with Governor Hickenlooper now ⬇️ https://t.co/jFDrCWUFrJ
.@usnews confirmed what every Coloradan already knows: this state is a great place to live. https://t.co/matK2CaIDA
I believe in Colorado and I’m fighting every day to ensure that every Coloradan has the opportunity to succeed. https://t.co/UFyTMNXXb7
“Senator Gardner understands that the federal government needs to work with Coloradans as neighbors - not as landlords.”   Read more from the @ColoradoSun here: https://t.co/q3TSpKVWLJ
Though there will always be differences of opinions we must always believe in Colorado and work together. #cosen #copolitics
Hickenlooper says he supports the CORE Act but when asked he couldn’t name a single component of the bill. #cosen #copolitics
Hickenlooper wants to rip hundreds of thousands of jobs away from Coloradans and make them obsolete. #copolitics #cosen
As someone who still is paying off student loan debt I know how important it is to help assist students and make college more affordable.
Hickenlooper was the first Governor to be found guilty of violating Colorado’s ethics laws. #cosen #copolitics
Even before the pandemic hit many of our workers lacked the experience they needed to find employment. I’ll continue to fight for Coloradans and give them the tools they need to succeed.
We can’t trust Hickenlooper to fill a Supreme Court vacancy.  Hickenlooper nominated a Colorado Supreme Court justice during his last year as Governor.
Since before the pandemic reached our shores I’ve been working hard to protect Coloradans from COVID-19.
✅Moved BLM headquarters to CO  ✅Passed the Great American Outdoors Act  ✅Established the 9-8-8 National Suicide Hotline  You can count on me to work hard for Colorado.
Republicans in the Senate proposed a plan for pandemic relief but democrats - including Hickenlooper - rejected it.  It’s about the people not politics.
I’ve continued to fight for relief for Coloradans. Hickenlooper failed to prepare the state for a pandemic. #cosen #copolitics

Hickenlooper has refused to take responsibility for his ethics violations. Let’s hold him accountable tonight.  You can watch my third debate with Hickenlooper now on @DenverChannel or online at @CPRNews and @denverpost.   Here’s the link ➡️ https://t.co/pAcsIobnCu https://t.co/X9ou1DCYwd

Though our contact with friends and loved ones is limited during this year’s #YomKippur observances I pray that the forthcoming fast will prove to be reflective and restorative. G’mar chatima tova!

Happy #NationalPublicLandsDay! In Colorado we enjoy some of our nation’s most beautiful public lands.  I’m proud to have written the Great American Outdoors Act which protects and preserves our public lands for generations to come. https://t.co/sJbAV8IZ4T

This weekend I had the opportunity to talk with folks in Delta.  From fire management to water conservancy every issue facing the Western Slope ultimately affects all Coloradans. https://t.co/T5OvoWhcJp
Colorado is more than just the Front Range. We must remain united as we bring all four corners of our state together to get through the challenges our state and nation face.

I’m the only rural Coloradan elected to represent Colorado statewide. We must promote policies that benefit all four corners our state. Rural Colorado must have a loud voice in Washington and I pledge to be that voice for the next six years.

There are 230000 oil and gas workers across Colorado that represent a $31 billion economic driver. And the tax revenues from Colorado’s energy industry help fund our schools roads and communities. Meanwhile @Hickenlooper wants to make this industry “obsolete” https://t.co/6UHF6rZRi5
I passed bipartisan legislation to make sure that we are protecting firefighters from injury and to ensure that we are applying the newest technologies to fight the wildfires our state is facing.
The people of Western Colorado are anxious for more opportunity not less. We need to work as a state —with all four corners— to make sure we get the job done.

I believe in a healthcare system that drives down cost and puts patients first. I’ll continue to fight for bipartisan solutions that benefit all Coloradans and protect those with pre-existing conditions.

My opponent Gov. John @Hickenlooper had an opportunity to be at the Club 20 debate today but didn’t show up. If you’re going to stand up for western Colorado you have to show up for western Colorado. He’s given up on the Western Slope. https://t.co/SFNj8UmhdP
Reminder: @Hickenlooper didn’t show up because he doesn’t want you to see this... https://t.co/ZPyHtma68a

On #ConstitutionDay we celebrate the signing of our nation’s most important document. We must continue to protect and defend our constitution in pursuit of a more just society.
By finding common ground and building consensus I’ve been able to get big things done and deliver for Colorado. https://t.co/aSWGnfwXjK

6 years ago I promised that I’d fight for all four corners of the state.  Since then I’ve secured millions of dollars to help fix our roads protect our national parks and more.  I’ll continue to fight for Coloradans from Cortez to Sedgwick.

People like my mother who battle chronic diseases are heroes. I authored the bill to guarantee coverage to people with pre-existing conditions—no matter what happens to Obamacare—because some things matter more than politics. https://t.co/uosfsAPvbc

I’ve worked hard to deliver for CO — passing trillions in COVID-19 relief listening to people across our entire state and working toward more relief. #GoBroncos! https://t.co/aETdbZYpIp

I continue to support our brave firefighters as they work to contain several wildfires in our state.  2 years ago I helped lead the effort to provide adequate resources for forest management so that firefighters could more effectively battle wildfires.

Today we honor the thousands of Americans who lost their lives 19 years ago and our brave first responders who risked everything to save others.  Times like these define our nation because we show the world that Americans are united by our belief in our country’s resilience. https://t.co/D7JaDBJ2CP

Veterans deserve our support. Thanks to organizations like the Mt. Carmel Veterans Service Center they are receiving the help they need.   Last weekend I had the honor of recognizing Colorado service members for their countless sacrifices. https://t.co/KdZo36J2dR

Thank you to @votetimscott for stopping by Colorado last week to lead an Opportunity Zone roundtable to discuss how we can continue to help underserved communities. https://t.co/Vudt9thmHt

In recent years we’ve lost more veterans to suicide than combat - roughly 200 a year in our state alone.   During this #SuicidePreventionWeek let’s remove the stigma around suicide and work toward policies that get all Coloradans the help they need.
By providing the funding to fix our national parks the Great American Outdoors Act will create over one-hundred thousand jobs in the process. https://t.co/wqxiufRaO3
Happy Labor Day from the Gardner family!   Today along with every day this year I am proud to celebrate the American workforce and the limitless future our country holds. https://t.co/wtsmbP7pMJ

As a bipartisan Senator who isn’t afraid to work with people across the aisle I’ve been able to get big things done for Colorado like passing historical conservation legislation and helping veterans get the care they need.

I authored the Great American Outdoors Act because Colorado’s public lands are worth protecting.   Now that it’s law future generations can enjoy Colorado’s outdoors for years to come. https://t.co/GZveq9TKbG

From day 1 I’ve worked to get things done. While others argue and play politics I’ve delivered for Colorado. Join #TeamGardner today and help me keep fighting for our state. https://t.co/0ipYltbnsh

Today marks 100 years since the 19th Amendment was ratified.   Decades earlier in 1893 Colorado became the first state to enact women’s suffrage by popular referendum.  I’m proud of the generations of women whose tenacity guaranteed women the right to vote. https://t.co/TdoLjqf1jX
Our environment isn’t a partisan issue. https://t.co/WnQ8PQqafG
Tim Scott is standing with #TeamGardner! Chip in today and help me fight for Colorado ➡️ https://t.co/fUOYpR3MiH https://t.co/IK9fSYfJYH
